segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, and I can't help but feel a little sorry for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's so focused on drying that plate, she doesn't even see the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and her foot is right in the middle of that puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really tired or something, to not notice all this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so quiet, sneaking those cookies like little thieves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they know how much trouble they could get into if she catches them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That boy on the stool, he's so brave or maybe just foolish, climbing up like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn't fall, but with that stool looking so wobbly, it's hard to say.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her treat, like it's the most natural thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this whole scene is just a snapshot of life, full of little moments that add up to something bigger.
segments.speaker: PAR
